Part of the code is a memory address, and another part is a value.

You're pretty much just setting values in memory to specific values.

For instance to start with more lives you're essentially finding where that value is stored and changing the value to a higher number.

I had a guy yelling at me the other night cause it showed I have a mic but I wasn‚Äôt talking to him. Jumped on the mic and said ‚Äúwell I guess I can mute you and not worry about it.‚Äù Muted him and he quit out of the lobby.

Instead of criticising a teammate, help them instead. Learn to communicate in constructive ways so that you can win as a team rather than just being insulting. 

If your only way of communicating with your team is "criticising" them (which I suspect is more just insulting them) then they're never going to do whatever you suggest. They'll just dig in their heels and you'll get more tilted.

Lots of people would probably love to see Rapture or Columbia (the settings from Bioshock 1/2 and Bioshock Infinite, respectively).

As for characters it's hard to go wrong with some of the classic gaming icons like Solid Snake (Metal Gear Solid), Ryu (Street Fighter) or Samus Aran (Metroid). Besides the obvious Mario or Link of course.

Me personally? Might be fun to see an Atelier protagonist. Any of them really but the most recent and honestly probably best known would be Ryza. Also something themed after a Yakuza character; I'd love to see Kazuma Kiryu's back tattoo on a candle.

Well, it's more like going from 1080P to 4k. 

a super ultrawide  5120 x 1440 moniter is 88% of the pixels of a 4k monitor.

an ultra wide 2560 x 1440 is only 44% of the pixels.

That's the cost difference there.

So modern warfare is amazing, but activision is doing weird things to roll it into cold war (which I do not recommend). I think modern warfare probably still has momentum behind it, but red dead is an epic single player campaign and has a good multiplayer that I think will be supported for a long time. Traditionally fps games fall off when new versions come out as the player base migrates, you might have a better experience overall with red dead

I'm similar to you. For me, it wasn't a Zelda game. I actually enjoy linear, easy to follow, not-so-open world games. The shrines weren't really full fledged dungeons.
